Economic growth: With the removal of debt, countries would have more resources to invest in their economies, leading to increased economic growth and development.
Improved living standards: The eradication of debt would allow governments to allocate more funds towards improving living standards, such as education, healthcare, and infrastructure.
Increased international cooperation: The removal of debt would reduce the tension between countries, as they would no longer be concerned about the repayment of loans or the consequences of default.
Reduced risk of financial crisis: The erasure of debt would eliminate the risk of financial crises caused by debt defaults or other economic shocks.
Increased global trade: With reduced financial stress, countries would be more likely to engage in international trade, leading to increased economic interdependence and global connectivity.
